Multiplication groups and relative multiplication groups
The right multiplication groupright multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}_r(Q) of a right quasigroup Q is the permutation groupg generated by all right translations of Q. The left multiplication groupleft multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}_\ell(Q) of a left quasigroup Q is defined dually. The multiplication group multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}(Q) of a quasigroup Q is the permutation group generated by all left and right translations of Q.
If S is a subrightquasigroup of a right quasigroup Q, the relative right multiplication grouprelative right multiplication group of S in Q is the subgroup of \textrm{Mlt}_r(Q) generated by all right translations in Q by elements of S. Note that there is a difference betwee the relative right multiplication group of S in Q and the right multiplication group of S. The relative left multiplication grouprelative left multiplication group and the relative multiplication grouprelative multiplication group of S in Q are defined analogously.
Multiplication groups
the (right, left) multiplication group of Q as a subgroup of the symmetric group on the set [1..Size(Parent(Q))]. An effort is made to precalculate a small generating set for the group.
Relative multiplication groups
the relative (right, left) multiplication group of S in the right quasigroup Q. Here, S must be a subalgebra of Q. An effort is made to precalculate a small generating set for the group.

Inner mappings and inner mapping groups
Elements of the multiplication groups that fix the identity element are called inner mappingsinner mappings in loop theory. We extend the definition of traditional inner mappings to right quasigroups and quasigroups
When Q is a right quasigroup and x,y\in Q, the right inner mapping right inner mapping determined by x and y is the permutation R(x,y) = R_{xy}^{-1} R_y R_x, where we compose mappings from right to left. The right inner mapping group right inner mapping group of Q is the subgroup of the right multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}_r(Q) of Q generated by all right inner mappings. When Q is a loop, the right inner mapping group is the stabilizer of the neutral element of Q in \textrm{Mlt}_r(Q).
When Q is a quasigroup and x,y\in Q, the middle inner mapping middle inner mapping determined by x is the permutation L(x)^{-1} R(x), and the left inner mappingleft inner mapping determined by x and y is the permutation L(x,y) = L_{yx}^{-1} L_y L_x. The middle inner mapping group middle inner mapping group of Q is the subgroup of the multiplication group of Q generated by all middle inner mappings. The left inner mapping group left inner mapping group of Q is the subgroup of the left multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}_\ell(Q) of Q generarted by all left inner mappings. When Q is a loop, the left inner mapping grup is the stabilizer of the neutral element of Q in \textrm{Mlt}_\ell(Q). Finally, the inner mapping groupinner mapping group of Q is the subroup of the multiplication group \textrm{Mlt}(Q) of Q generated by all right, middle and left inner mappings. When Q is a loop, the inner mapping group is the stabilizer of the neutral element of Q in \textrm{Mlt}(Q).
Inner mappings
the right, middle and left inner mappings in Q determined by x (and y). For the right inner mappings, Q can be a right quasigroups. For the middle and left inner mappings, Q must be a quasigroup.
Inner mapping groups
the (right, middle, left) inner mapping group of a quasigroup Q. For the right inner mapping group, we alow Q to be a right quasigroup.
